Therefore, the verdict is based on the presence of an unidentified man, but the claim of being a murderous taxi driver is unsupported.

While it is possible for a news caption to describe an unidentified man accused of being a murderous taxi driver, there is no way to verify this claim without further information.  The plausibility depends entirely on whether such a case exists or has been reported. The claim itself is not inherently impossible, but lacks evidence to support its truthfulness.
